meanings.definition: Presuming or taking something for granted without proof.
meanings.sent1: She made an assumptive statement without checking the facts.
meanings.sent2: The assumptive behavior led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: His assumptive attitude made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The assumptive decision was like jumping without looking.
meanings.sent5: The assumptive nature of his actions was clear to all.

meanings.definition: Based on an assumption rather than evidence.
meanings.sent1: Their assumptive conclusion was proven wrong later.
meanings.sent2: The assumptive theory lacked solid proof.
meanings.sent3: The assumptive approach seemed risky but worked out well.
meanings.sent4: Her assumptive reasoning was like building a house on sand.
meanings.sent5: The assumptive nature of the plan became evident over time.
